text: So you've found my 'About Me' section... What do you really want to know?

options.text: What have I been up to?
What did I used to do?
Tell me about your web development experience
What was I like in high school?

text: Most recently, I've been working for Superfly, an experiential design company responsible for Bonnaroo, Outside Lands, and the Friends Experience. Here I manage multiple web apps in Vue and React, and manage our back end AWS databases in Node.JS.

options.text: Tell me about your web development experience
What's your favorite project?
Where did you go to school?
What did you use to do?

text: I used to be a video shooter/editor. That also included building servers, scripting automation processes within the adobe cloud, and working within teams or leading interns. I've interviewed, shot, and edited artists such as Snoop Dogg, Florence and the Machine, and Dave Mathews. I've also made work for David Byrne that was featured at MoMA PS1.

options.text: See my old reel
What's your favorite project?
What was your favorite celebrity to meet?
Tell me about your web development experience

text: I was a little odd, but not TOO odd. I was really into playing synthesizers and performing as if I were David Bowie or something. I fondly remember this time, although I wouldn't want to be that kid again.

options.text: What have I been up to?
What did I used to do?
Tell me about your web development experience

text: Currently at Superfly, I work primarily in Next.js and Nuxt web apps, building them from scratch and creating a robust CMS for them so my coworkers can make codeless edits to our sites. At my previous job, I designed a JavaScript creative automation application that helped us globally scale adds for companies such as Google and Spotify. In December 2020 I completed a full stack web development bootcamp, adding to the two years of Java and JavaScript education I had in college. Most recently I worked for a large pharmaceutical company editing banner ads and Gatsby websites.

text: I was a little odd, but not TOO odd. I was really into playing synthesizers and performing as if I were David Bowie or something. I fondly remember this time, although I wouldn't want to be that kid again.

options.text: What have I been up to?
What did I used to do?
Tell me about your web development experience

text: Most recently I completed IronHack Web Development Bootcamp in Lisbon Portugal. The Pasteis De Nata were wonderful. My background however is originally in creative technology, as I majored in Post Production/New Media at Emerson College in 2016. This included two years of programming courses in Java and JavaScript

options.text: What have I been up to?
What did I used to do?
Tell me about your web development experience

text: Definitely Snoop Dogg. There's no question. He was easily the nicest person I've met in that setting, and super funny. Otherwise, I enjoyed talking to Cam'ron about making Bill O'Reiley mad, and meeting David Byrne was a personal feat for me.

options.text: What have I been up to?
What did I used to do?
Tell me about your web development experience

text: At my last job, we were coding banner ads in orders of over 100 per quarter for Spotify. This seemed tedius, so on my own time I worked to see if there was a way to create a JavaScript application that can anticipate creative sizing and automate aspects such as copy, image, and color changes. As a result we were able to automate our process and scale to larger development. By the time we left, our quarterly ask for banner ads was in the 1000s and not only featured global ads for Spotify, but we added Google to our client roster as well.
